channel.title: Archiving on archive on archive on archive
channel.description:
Hey! Would just like to say a thing... haaz boring ;D
Compress and archive a file or folder.. then archive that archive... archive that archive with that other archive.. and so on.. til it gets 1KB.. Start with a file who is on 5MB. Then upload it on a host and post the link here :rolleyes:
[ Can start to say.. you need to move, copy, paste, cut and much much to get it to work. ]

item.title: Archiving on archive on archive on archive
item.dc:creator: @lotto320 lotto320
item.description:
@lotto320 wrote:

[quote=“ollie123, post:8, topic:375309”]Yes, e.g. Kibibyte is 2 to the power of something: e.g. 1KiB = 2^10 = 1024
But Kilobyte is 10 to the power of something: e.g. 1KB = 10^3 = 1000[/quote]

Ughh?

Read full topic
item.source: Archiving on archive on archive on archive

item.title: Archiving on archive on archive on archive
item.dc:creator: @ollie123 Ollie123
item.description:
@ollie123 wrote:

Yes, e.g. Kibibyte is 2 to the power of something: e.g. 1KiB = 2^10 = 1024
But Kilobyte is 10 to the power of something: e.g. 1KB = 10^3 = 1000

Read full topic
item.source: Archiving on archive on archive on archive

item.title: Archiving on archive on archive on archive
item.dc:creator: @lotto320 lotto320
item.description:
@lotto320 wrote:

[quote=“RuneSpace, post:13, topic:375314”][quote author=lotto320 link=topic=471263.msg3447566#msg3447566 date=1293528475]

When you compress a file, the goal of the program doing the compressing is to compress it down to the smallest size possible. This means that compressing it again isn’t going to help you or make it smaller at all, in fact, generally, it makes it bigger the more times you compress it, simply due to the extra overhead. Try it and you’ll see what I mean.
[/quote]The OP said to make it bigger; ‘start with something 5mb and compress it until it’s 1KB.’

mb is bigger than kb…?

LOL?? its B - KB - MB - GB - TB

Bit Byte KiloByte Megabyte Gigabyte Terabyte Pedabyte Exabyte Zettabyte Yottabyte

     -Multiples of bytes-

kilobyte (kB) kibibyte (KiB)
megabyte (MB) mebibyte (MiB)
gigabyte (GB) gibibyte (GiB)
terabyte (TB) tebibyte (TiB)
petabyte (PB) pebibyte (PiB)
exabyte (EB) exbibyte (EiB)
zettabyte (ZB) zebibyte (ZiB)
yottabyte (YB) yobibyte (YiB)

[url]http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yottabyte[url]

Wut? I learnt my post on a computer course thing January '08 ;D[/quote]

Lol… eehh we are quoting everytime xD getting massive

btw… read my sig xD

lool, likes Moparisthebest’s pic xD Mopar or no car!!

Read full topic
item.source: Archiving on archive on archive on archive
